diagnostic-feedback.description:
Next, you'll do a more formal assessment of your team’s strengths and challenges in the areas of alignment, execution, and renewal, and consider the actions (including day-to-day management, feedback, coaching, and others) that you might take to make your teams more effective.

We've developed a team effectiveness assessment to help you; it should take no more than 10 minutes to complete. Answer the questions below. If you are a part of multiple teams, refer to only one team as you answer the questions.
diagnostic-feedback.results:
[ { "group": "Alignment", "html_body": "

Alignment appears to a relative strength of your team.

Alignment refers to the fact that a team has a shared understanding of its mission. Teams that achieve good alignment have:

    • A shared set of guiding principles or beliefs about
      • The team’s purpose
      • The professional values guiding the team
      • The balance between collective and personal interests
    • A shared understanding of the business, including:
      • The organizational context of their team’s goals
      • The business’s overall strategy and performance goals

", "image": "", "internal_description": "", "max_value": "20", "min_value": "16", "name": "Alignment high", "order": "0" }, { "group": "Execution", "html_body": "

Your team appears to have some room for improvement in alignment

Alignment refers to the fact that a team has a shared understanding of its mission. Actions that can improve alignment include:

    • Instituting effective communication processes that give teams members clarity on their short- and long-term goals
    • Provide in-the-moment course corrections to align team members on direction; solicit feedback to enable team members to give input to the team’s direction
    • Engage in thoughtful coaching that helps team members self-discover areas of strength and areas for improvement

", "image": "", "internal_description": "", "max_value": "15", "min_value": "11", "name": "Alignment medium", "order": "1" }, { "group": "Renewal", "html_body": "

Alignment appears to a relative weakness of your team.

Teams suffering from poor alignment might be in disagreement about their goals, not cooperating well, or unaware of roadblocks. Poor alignment can exhibit itself as silo thinking, blind spots, paralysis, or appropriately, “pseudo-alignment.”

 

", "image": "", "internal_description": "", "max_value": "10", "min_value": "4", "name": "Alignment low", "order": "2" }, { "group": "Alignment", "html_body": "

Execution appears to a relative strength of your team.

Execution refers to a team’s ability to communicate, collaborate, and make progress towards its goals.

Strong execution depends on:

    • Effective day-to-day management
      • Clear processes, roles, and responsibilities
      • Mechanisms to communicate short- and long-term work assignments
      • Mechanisms to measure progress against goal
      • Tools to deal with the unexpected
    • Productive interpersonal relationships
      • Mutual respect, understanding, and trust
      • Open communication, challenge, and no “groupthink”
      • Constructive conflict management and resolution
", "image": "", "internal_description": "", "max_value": "3", "min_value": "0", "name": "Execution", "order": "3" } ]
diagnostic-feedback.title: Assess your team’s alignment, execution, and renewal

diagnostic-feedback.description:

diagnostic-feedback.title: Buzfeed Quiz
